name: Isla Grande Flying School
about: Isla Grande Flying School, located on the North Ramp of Fernando L. Ribas-Dominicci Airport in San Juan, Puerto Rico, has been a beacon of excellence in aviation training since 1953. As one of only three FAA and Department of Education recognized schools in Puerto Rico, it offers a comprehensive range of training programs for airplane and helicopter pilots. The school boasts a diverse fleet including basic single-engine trainers, advanced "glass cockpit" aircraft, complex aircraft, twin-engine airplanes, tail draggers, and helicopters. As the first International Cessna Pilot Center, Isla Grande Flying School is committed to providing high-quality training with highly qualified and experienced instructors. With nearly seven decades of service, the school remains a one-stop shop for all aviation needs in Puerto Rico, dedicated to helping students achieve their dream of flight.
